title: When the Merger Moment Is Right
text:
Foreign ownership has become the new standard of care for shareholders suffering from a lack of desire to pay the industrialized world’s highest corporate income tax rates. So perhaps it’s no surprise that Canada’s Valeant is aiming to buy the North Carolina maker of a new female libido drug, according to the Journal. A recent editorial explained why the foreign takeover wave created by Washington tax policy is not just bad for U.S. workers but also makes the whole world poorer.
